title: The Structural Integrity of the Self: On Heartbreak and Rebuilding
excerpt: We speak of heartbreak as a sudden snap. A single, violent flash, and then, the dark. As if the heart were a lightbulb that simply burns out. But the truth of a collapse is rarely so honest. It is more often the story of a quiet, rising heat. An invisible, internal stress, building in the core, unseen....
